summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an individual to appear and testify before the grand jury on July 24, 2019, and to produce documents. The subpoena is part of an investigation into alleged violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes. An accompanying letter requests the recipient to keep the subpoena confidential.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and signed the accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The subpoena commands the recipient to appear before the grand jury at the United States Courthouse in Manhattan to testify and give evidence.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York, Southern District of New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an investigation into alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 2421 (transportation for prostitution), 2422 (coercion and enticement), 2423 (transportation of minors), and 371 (conspiracy).
The recipient is commanded to appear before the grand jury on July 24, 2019, at 10:00 a.m. and to produce unspecified items (presumably documents).
The U.S. Attorney's Office requests the recipient voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
Failure to comply with the subpoena constitutes contempt of court and subjects the recipient to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
